properties.name: Cats vs Aliens (an Object Spawner example)
properties.description: Learn how to use the Object Spawner extension to spawn waves of enemies in stages.
properties.author: Victris Games

events.comment: Set values based on current level so they spawn more objects and move faster
Count enemies that are already spawned
Count enemies waiting to be spawned

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: DrawShockWaveEffect
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Will allow you to draw shock wave effects.
description: This behavior must be assigned to a shape painter object.
The user will have state parameters (Start and End) like the particle emitter object, which are :
- Type(Fill or Line)
- The color transition (Start / End).
- The opacity transition (Start / End).
- The transition of angle (Start / End).
- The transition of the radius of the explosion (Start / End).
- The transition of the contour size (Start / End).
- The duration of the propagation.
The user can modify the values according to his needs.
You can modify the value of the object just after the creation of the object in the event sheet (all modifications are applied on the shape painter object created above the modification).
PS: the shape-painter will be automatically deleted once the animation is finished.

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
It can be used for:
- Hit or impact
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking
eventsFunctions.sentence: Stop shaking _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ is shaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake

eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking

eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ is shaking

eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ObjectSpawner
description: Spawn objects periodically and control their number.
It can be used to create:
- Enemies
- NPCs
- Environmental objects

eventsFunctions.description: Spawn (create) objects periodically. This action must be run every frame to work. When the max quantity is reached and an instance is deleted, the spawner waits the duration of the spawn period before creating another instance. Spawned objects are automatically linked to the spawner.
eventsFunctions.name: SpawnObject
eventsFunctions.sentence: Periodically spawn (create) a _PARAM2_ located at spawner _PARAM0_

events.comment: Check if max number of instances per spawner has been reached. Always spawn objects if quantity is set to "0"
Prevent objects from being spawned immediately after deleting an object while at max quantity alive
Check if max number of instances per spawner has been reached
Spawn an object when conditions are met. Spawned objects are linked to the spawner that made them

eventsFunctions.description: Change the offset X relative to the center of spawner (in pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: SetOffsetX
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the offset X of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ pixels

eventsFunctions.description: Change the offset Y relative to the center of spawner (in pixels).
eventsFunctions.name: SetOffsetY
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the offset Y of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ pixels

eventsFunctions.description: Change the spawn period (in seconds).
eventsFunctions.name: SetSpawnPeriod
eventsFunctions.sentence: Change the spawn period of _PARAM0_ to _PARAM2_ seconds

eventsFunctions.description: Return the offset X relative to the center of spawner (in pixels).

eventsFunctions.description: Return the offset Y relative to the center of spawner (in pixels).

eventsFunctions.description: Return the spawn period (in seconds).

eventsFunctions.sentence: Restart the cooldown of _PARAM0_

eventsFunctions.name: ObjectWasJustSpawned
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ just spawned an object

eventsFunctions.description: the max objects in the scene (per spawner) of the object. Limits the number of objects in the scene that were created by this spawner. Set this to 0 for no limit.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Max objects in the scene (per spawner)
eventsFunctions.name: MaxQuantity
eventsFunctions.sentence: the max objects in the scene (per spawner)

eventsFunctions.description: Check if spawner has unlimited capacity.
eventsFunctions.name: UnlimitedObjectCapacity
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ has unlimited capacity

eventsFunctions.name: SetUnlimitedObjectCapacity
eventsFunctions.sentence: _PARAM0_ unlimited capacity: _PARAM2_

eventsFunctions.description: the number of objects that can be created by this spawner. This is reduced everytime an objects is spawned.
eventsFunctions.name: SpawnerCapacity
eventsFunctions.sentence: the spawner capacity
